thread.title: Israeli Prez Apologizes to Mexico After Netanyahu Tweets Support for Trump, Border Walls
thread.title_full: Israeli Prez Apologizes to Mexico After Netanyahu Tweets Support for Trump, Border Walls

author: Ken Meyer
title: Israeli Prez Apologizes to Mexico After Netanyahu Tweets Support for Trump, Border Walls
text:
Israeli Prez Apologizes to Mexico After Netanyahu Tweets Support for Trump, Border Walls by Ken Meyer | 9:30   
Israeli President Reuven Rivlin is saying sorry to his peers in Mexico after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemingly endorsed President Trump â€˜s call for a U.S.-Mexican border wall. 
Netanyahu caught the attention of Mexico when he tweeted this on Saturday: President Trump is right. I built a wall along Israel's southern border. It stopped all illegal immigration. Great success. Great idea ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ 
â€” Benjamin Netanyahu (@netanyahu) January 28, 2017 
The subject of border walls has been the source of a major rift recently between Trump and Mexican President Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto . Last week, Trump signed an executive order to start construction of a wall on Americaâ€™s southern border. Mexico responded by cancelling a meeting with Trump and promising once again that their government will not pay the cost for the wall. 
Mexican foreign officials were reportedly dismayed when they saw Netanyahuâ€™s tweet, and they asked that he apologize. Though Rivlinâ€™s position in the Israeli government is mostly ceremonial, he offered a conciliatory statement while contrasting the differences between Israel and Mexicoâ€™s border security situations. 
â€œI am sorry for any hurt caused as a result of this misunderstanding,â€ Rivlin said, â€œbut we must remember that we are talking about a misunderstanding, and I am sure that we can put the issue behind us.â€ 
Netanyahu brought up the commotion during a cybersecurity conference on Monday, where he said his words referred to Trumpâ€™s recent praise for Israelâ€™s barrier on the Egyptian border. 
â€œI did not comment about U.S.-Mexico relations. Weâ€™ve had, and will continue to have, good relations with Mexico,â€ Netanyahu said.
